description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to remove condition no.5 (approved plans), seeking to allow works under permitted development rights, in pursuant to planning permission reference  P/2007/3934 dated 29/11/2007 for' Construction of a part two and single storey end of terrace house; and parking.'
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The external surfaces of the development shall be constructed in accordance with the materials indicated on drawing ref: 010-101 and 'Design and Access Statement' received on 22 August 2007 shall only be used in the development hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan 2021 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The hard and soft landscaping works indicated on drawing ref: 010-102 rev. A received on 15 October 2007 shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained for the duration of the development. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area, ensuring suitable amenity spaces are provided for future occupants, and providing sustainable urban drainage in accordance with policies G4, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); and 5.10, 7A, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The car parking layout (providing a space of 2.4m x 4.8m for a car) on drawing ref: 010-102 rev.A received on 15 October 2007 shall be marked out on site prior to first occupation of any part of the development and this space shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with policies T6 and T6.1 of the London Plan (2021). | The approved development shall be carried in accordance with the recommendations of: A report on the site history and other environmental factors ref: RS32937417_1_1 dated 28th October 2010 prepared by Landmark Information Group received 8th November 2010, approved by the Local Planning Authority under application PP/2010/4508 on 02/01/2011.
Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policy SD1 of the London Plan and Policy 5.21 of the Development Management DPD (2013).

| A plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be installed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The design and siting of the boundary fencing to the front of the house shall be informed by the requirement to retain an area of 1.5m by 1.5m pedestrian visibility splays, and those areas shall have no obstructions above a height of 0.6m at the vehicle access point. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details of boundary treatment shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and safety and security of residents, in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan 2021 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings ref. 0101-101 received on 22 August 2007 and ref. 101-102 rev. A received on 15 October 2007, the details of the development hereby approved, the proposed house shall have level access points to the main (front) entrances of the house shall be provided, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure access for all in accordance with Policy D4 and D5 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD.
